item.title: Angloinfo and Nexus have joined forces to launch additional expat sites in Asia through a joint venture
item.description:
Source: Angloinfo’s Hong Kong portal. Angloinfo, a global network for expats, has partnered with Nexus to establish Angloinfo Asia, a joint venture. Their first project is the Angloinfo.com/hongkong website, which has been launched gradually and is expected to be fully operational by August 2016. The joint venture aims to introduce more localized versions of Angloinfo throughout Asia and China in the coming months, catering to the growing number of expats in these regions...

item.title: Expatstoday provides important advice for expatriates living in the Gulf region
item.description:
Source: Expatstoday A new online platform, Expatstoday, aims to attract individuals considering a move to Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, or the UAE. The website provides insights into living conditions in these Gulf countries. The company behind the platform emphasizes its commitment to providing accurate, current, and trustworthy information. While the sections dedicated to Gulf countries appear well-established, suggesting an active user base, pages for other countries seem relatively new, often lacking listings in various categories...

item.title: Asian cities have been rearranged in Mercer's Cost of Living Survey
item.description:
Five Asian cities—Hong Kong (ranked 2nd), Tokyo (3rd), Singapore (5th), Seoul (6th), and Shanghai (8th)—were named among the top 10 most expensive cities for expatriates in this year’s ranking. Currency fluctuations played a significant role in shaping the rankings of most Asian cities. While all mainland Chinese cities surveyed experienced a drop in ranking, Tianjin (12th) stood out as an exception, climbing 18 positions. Mumbai, India made a remarkable jump of 25 places this year, attributed to robust economic growth, inflation, and a stable currency...
